properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 6 at 4:07AM PST until January 6 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TODAY AND TONIGHT FOR THE CASCADES...
NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...AND THE IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.A storm system will arrive this morning with snow expanding into
many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho. Moderate to
heavy snow accumulations are expected and will likely impact
morning travel across the low elevations. Snow will transition to
rain for the Palouse and Spokane - Coeur D Alene Areas by this
afternoon.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Omak, Okanogan, Brewster, Bridgeport, Oroville,
Nespelem, and Disautel Pass.

* WHEN...From 5 AM to 10 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of black ice will be possible before
snow develops. Snow on top of black ice may lead to very slick
conditions for the Monday morning commute, especially along
untreated roadways. Valley snow is expected to change to rain
late this morning or midday.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING
